alert.note: Alert for Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:23PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Haskell, southeastern McIntosh, northeastern Pittsburg and southeastern Muskogee Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 923 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Webbers Falls to 2 miles northeast of Eufaula. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Eufaula... Stigler... Warner... Quinton... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Whitefield... Kinta... Tamaha... Briartown... Enterprise... Kanima... Lewisville... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 276 and 288. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern and east central Oklahoma. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
